update.description:
[DART 4.0 has been released](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0). It improves support for universal and screw joints (partial fixes to #1096, #1011), joint springs (partial fix for #975) and complete fixes for #910, #1079, #1174.

DART 4.0 has a lot of API changes, so merging this pull request will make DART 4.0 the minimum required version. There is a minor ABI breakage in DARTLink.hh, but I have targeted this to the gazebo_3.1 branch since we have not yet released any debian packages that link against dart. If people think this is a bad idea, I will re-target to default.

To test, you can build dart from source (use [v4.0 tag](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0) or [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0)) or install libdart-core4-dev from the dartsim ppa (also requires libccd and fcl):
~~~
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev
~~~

I still need to update the homebrew formula.

UPDATE: it is now required to build dart from the [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0), as there are some fixes there that haven't been tagged and released yet.
update.title: DART 4.0 support

content.html: Did you build gazebo_3.0_dart_4.0 branch? There is no header inclusion of GenCoord.h and ConstraintDynamics.h in dart_inc.h of gazebo_3.0_dart_4.0 branch.

content.raw:
With both of these includes removed, I get the following error:


```
#!c++

/data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTBallJoint.cc: In member function ‘virtual gazebo::math::Vector3 gazebo::physics::DARTBallJoint::GetAnchor(unsigned int) const’:
/data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTBallJoint.cc:55:48: error: ‘class dart::dynamics::BodyNode’ has no member named ‘getWorldTransform’
   Eigen::Isometry3d T = this->dtChildBodyNode->getWorldTransform() *
```
content.html:

/data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTBallJoint.cc:55:48: error: ‘class dart::dynamics::BodyNode’ has no member named ‘getWorldTransform’
   Eigen::Isometry3d T = this->dtChildBodyNode->getWorldTransform() *

content.raw: I think we also need to remove `ConstraintDynamics.h` from `dart_inc.h`
content.html: I think we also need to remove ConstraintDynamics.h from dart_inc.h

I've installed from the releas-4.0 branch, and now I get this error:

In file included from /data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTJoint.hh:26:0,
                 from /data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTBallJoint.hh:22,
                 from /data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTBallJoint.cc:21:
/data/gazebo_pr_1126/gazebo/physics/dart/dart_inc.h:40:36: fatal error: dart/dynamics/GenCoord.h: No such file or directory
 #include <dart/dynamics/GenCoord.h>

There is no "GenCoord.h" file. Can we remove this include from gazebo/physics/dart/dart_inc.h?

content.raw:
This method injects artificial energy into the system which may result in unstable dynamics. [An issue](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/issues/201) is created about this in DART.

Should we mark this as not passing DropStuff test?
content.html:
This method injects artificial energy into the system which may result in unstable dynamics. An issue is created about this in DART.

Should we mark this as not passing DropStuff test?
Added comment in #1096.

content.raw:
This has nothing to do with the use of mesh collision geometry. 

DART reduces position constraint error (e.g., unexpected penetration between bodies) indirectly by generating error correction velocity, which is different with ODE. ODE directly changes the pose of the body to correct the position constraint violation without any additional velocity.

The error correction velocity of DART sometimes too large when the penetration is large. To handle this unwanted bouncing, DART has two parameters, which are error reduction parameter (ERP) (similar to ODE's)  and maximum error reduction velocity (ERV).

The current default ERV is 10 m/s. I think this is too large. I'll decrease the default ERP by 0.001 m/s then DART can pass test.
content.html:
This has nothing to do with the use of mesh collision geometry.

DART reduces position constraint error (e.g., unexpected penetration between bodies) indirectly by generating error correction velocity, which is different with ODE. ODE directly changes the pose of the body to correct the position constraint violation without any additional velocity.

The error correction velocity of DART sometimes too large when the penetration is large. To handle this unwanted bouncing, DART has two parameters, which are error reduction parameter (ERP) (similar to ODE's) and maximum error reduction velocity (ERV).

The current default ERV is 10 m/s. I think this is too large. I'll decrease the default ERP by 0.001 m/s then DART can pass test.
